title: Russia Signals Gas Pipeline Deal as Xi, Putin Deepen Ties
description: Russia’s Gazprom PJSC said it signed a legally binding agreement to build the long-anticipated Power of Siberia 2 gas pipeline to China via Mongolia. Beijing has yet to confirm the detail of Miller’s pronouncement as Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin met in Beijing on Tuesday. Minmin Low reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping, the Russian leader Vladimir Putin, and Indian PM Narendra modi presenting a united front at China's annual security summit. Joining us now is Bloomberg's Minmin Low. Welcome to the program. Just walk us through what's been happening over the past day or so. Yeah. Today Putin and he had a meeting and it was one that came with a lot of breakthroughs because the big deal that was signed was between Gazprom, which is Russia's state owned company, and China agreeing to build this power of Siberia to pipeline, which would help to divert a lot of the gas pipeline sales to Europe, Europe to China instead. And that would help the company recoup about 30% of those gas pipeline that was diverted that was that used to be sold to Europe, to China. So a very important breakthrough because this was something that has been under discussion for many, many years. Presidency and China had been reluctant to sign onto the deal because they didn't see it as urgent to continue to step up gas purchases from Russia. They didn't want to over rely on Russia as well. And this deal coming as President Trump has been threatening more tariffs on China if it continues to buy Russian oil. Interestingly, we see the same thing with Modi as well. Modi's, India's largest state owned company, oil company, saying it will continue to buy every single drop of Russian oil available as long as it remains economical. Really a slap in the face for President Trump and perhaps showing that Trump's additional tariffs to punish India is in some ways backfiring.
summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin have been meeting at the annual security summit in Beijing, China, and India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The meeting resulted in a significant breakthrough in a deal signed between Gazprom, Russia's state-owned company, and China agreeing to build a power of Siberia to pipeline, which would divert a significant amount of gas pipeline sales from Europe to China. This comes as President Trump has threatened to increase tariffs on China if it continues to buy Russian oil.
shortSummary: Chinese President Xi Jinping, Russian President Vladimir Putin, and Indian PM Narendra Modi signed a deal to divert some of their country's gas pipeline revenue away from Europe.
argos_summary: Gazprom signed a legally binding agreement to build the Power of Siberia 2 pipeline to China, diverting gas sales from Europe. The deal, signed amid talks between Xi and Putin, could help China secure 30% of diverted gas and may counter U.S. tariff threats. India’s Modi also signals continued Russian oil purchases, challenging U.S. tariff policy.
